info.title: How to use
info.body:
StructGen allows you to quickly create folder and file structures from a plain text description. Simply enter the structure definition, and the application will automatically create all folders and files in the selected location.

âš ï¸ Important
- Everything is always created only inside the selected root directory.
- Attempts to go outside the root directory are ignored (counted as "Skipped").
- If a folder or file already exists, it is not overwritten (counted as "Skipped").
- Empty lines are ignored.

ğŸ“ How it works
- Each line describes one location in the structure.
- Format: folder_path: file_list
- Left side before the colon ":" â€“ folder path.
- Right side after the colon â€“ list of files (separated by commas).
- Folders are separated with "/".
- You can create structures of any depth.

âœ¨ All possible variants

Variant 1: Single file (root level)
: README.md

Variant 2: Folder only (without files)
src/components

Variant 3: Folder with files
src/components: Button.jsx, Card.jsx

Variant 4: Multiple files at root level
: README.md, .gitignore, package.json

Variant 5: Deep folder with files
src/components/ui/buttons: PrimaryButton.tsx, SecondaryButton.tsx

Variant 6: More complex structure example
src/components: Button.jsx, Card.jsx
src/utils: helpers.js, constants.js
public: index.html, favicon.ico
config: settings.json
